title: Armand Lévy (activist)
text:
Armand Lévy (12 March 1827 – 23 March 1891) was a French lawyer and journalist.
Lévy was an <a href="Anti-clericalism">anti-clericalist</a>, a <a href="Freemasonry">freemason</a>, a <a href="French%20Second%20Republic">republican</a> and a <a href="Socialism">socialist</a> who supported the <a href="French%20Revolution%20of%201848">1848 Revolution</a> and the <a href="Paris%20Commune">Paris Commune</a>. Born in a <a href="Catholic%20Church">Roman Catholic</a> family, but with a <a href="Jews">Jewish</a> grand-father, he was passionate about the Jewish cause. He fought alongside his illustrious friends, such as <a href="Adam%20Mickiewicz">Adam Mickiewicz</a>, <a href="Ion%20C.%20Br%C4%83tianu">Ion Brătianu</a> and <a href="Camillo%20Benso%2C%20Count%20of%20Cavour">Camillo Cavour</a>, for the independence of <a href="Poland">Poland</a> and <a href="Romania">Romania</a>, and for the <a href="Italian%20unification">unification of Italy</a>.
